channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump suggests US taxpayers could reimburse oil firms for Venezuela investment
item.description: President says a ‘tremendous amount of money’ will need to be spent repairing country’s infrastructure Business live – latest updates Venezuela live –...

item.title: Wes Streeting warns of ‘disintegration’ of rules-based world order after Venezuela attack
item.description: UK health secretary declines to criticise Donald Trump directly but suggests he is disturbed by events of recent days UK politics – live updates Venez...

item.title: US raid on Venezuela ‘undermined a fundamental principle of international law’, says UN rights body – live
item.description: Spokesperson for UN high commissioner says ‘accountability for human rights violations cannot be achieved by unilateral military intervention’ Deposed...

item.title: Nature boys and girls – here’s your chance to get published in the Guardian
item.description: Our wildlife series Young Country Diary is looking for articles written by children, about their winter encounters with nature Once again, the Young C...

item.title: Kemi Badenoch says Trump’s Venezuela raid was ‘morally’ right – UK politics live
item.description: Conservative leader questions robustness of rules-based international order and says ‘the world has changed’ The latest YouGov weekly poll for the Tim...

item.title: Tomorrowland to hold its first-ever Asia festival in Thailand
item.description: Founded 20 years ago, Tomorrowland has grown into one of the most iconic celebrations of electronic music.

item.title: Drivers over 70 to face eye tests every three years
item.description: The move is part of the government's new road safety strategy, which plans to reform driving laws in Britain.

item.title: Nvidia unveils self-driving car tech as it seeks to power more products with AI
item.description: The chip giant is looking for ways to move the AI revolution beyond software and into physical products.

item.title: Is AI taking the fun out of fantasy football?
item.description: Some fans of FPL and other leagues are turning to chatbots and apps to get a leg up over other players.

item.title: US action in Venezuela morally right, Badenoch says
item.description: The Conservative leader tells the BBC the military operation raises "serious questions about the rules-based order".
